cs351.project2

Class TriangleRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs351.project2.TriangleRenderer

  • public class TriangleRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Draws triangles to a buffered image. This is not thread safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TriangleRenderer(int width, int height)
      Creates a new TriangleRenderer with the given width and height (in pixels).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears all pixel data that had been previously written.
      javafx.scene.image.Image convertToImage()
      Converts the internal BufferedImage to a JavaFX Image.
      int getHeight()
      Gets the height of the BufferedImage in pixels.
      int getPackedARGB(int x, int y)
      Returns an int with the ARGB values packed into it.
      float[] getRGBA(int x, int y)
      Returns an array containing the unpacked RGBA values.
      int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the BufferedImage in pixels.
      void markComplete()
      Call this after calling either renderTriangle or clear (after every set of calls to them).
      static int packData(float[] color, boolean packAsARGB)
      If packAsARGB is true, the value will be packed with the alpha value being first (most significant bits) - otherwise it will be packed last (least significant bits).
      void renderTriangle(float[] xVertices, float[] yVertices, float[] color)
      Expects 3 different vertices between the two vertex arrays, and a color of the form {red, green, blue, alpha} where the alpha component is normalized.
      static float[] unpackData(int argb)
      Takes an int representing all 4 color values and unpacks them into a float array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • TriangleRenderer

        public TriangleRenderer(int width,
                        int height)
        Creates a new TriangleRenderer with the given width and height (in pixels).
        Parameters:
        width - width (in pixels)
        height - height (in pixels)

    • Method Detail

      • renderTriangle

        public void renderTriangle(float[] xVertices,
                           float[] yVertices,
                           float[] color)
        Expects 3 different vertices between the two vertex arrays, and a color of the form {red, green, blue, alpha} where the alpha component is normalized.
        Parameters:
        xVertices - array of in-order x-values
        yVertices - array of in-order y-values
        color - RGBA color (alpha normalized)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all pixel data that had been previously written.

      • markComplete

        public void markComplete()
        Call this after calling either renderTriangle or clear (after every set of calls to them).

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the BufferedImage in pixels.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage width in pixels

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the BufferedImage in pixels.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage height in pixels

      • getPackedARGB

        public int getPackedARGB(int x,
                         int y)
        Returns an int with the ARGB values packed into it.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate into the BufferedImage
        y - y-coordinated into the BufferedImage
        Returns:
        packed int

      • getRGBA

        public float[] getRGBA(int x,
                       int y)
        Returns an array containing the unpacked RGBA values.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate into the BufferedImage
        y - y-coordinated into the BufferedImage
        Returns:
        float[] array with the unpacked RGBA values

      • convertToImage

        public javafx.scene.image.Image convertToImage()
        Converts the internal BufferedImage to a JavaFX Image.
        Returns:
        JavaFX Image representing the internal BufferedImage

      • packData

        public static int packData(float[] color,
                           boolean packAsARGB)
        If packAsARGB is true, the value will be packed with the alpha value being first (most significant bits) - otherwise it will be packed last (least significant bits).
        Parameters:
        color - color array (r, g, b, a) with a normalized alpha
        packAsARGB - true if ARGB, false if RGBA
        Returns:
        packed data

      • unpackData

        public static float[] unpackData(int argb)
        Takes an int representing all 4 color values and unpacks them into a float array. The alpha value will be [0.0, 1.0] while the rest will be [0.0, 255.0].
        Parameters:
        argb - int representing the 4 color values
        Returns:
        an array with the unpacked data
